code_quality.details: Good naming conventions and meaningful variable names. Clean separation with routes/, database/ directories. Proper error handling with try/catch and appropriate HTTP codes (422, 404, 500). Parameterized SQL queries — no eval(). Some console.log statements remain (e.g., 'someone hit the root endpoint', 'creating todo'). No .env.example file. Helper functions (toObj, toArray) are well-placed but inline in routes file.

documentation.details: README is solid — includes badges (CI, Coverage, Quality Gate), feature list, stack, install instructions, test commands, and CI/CD pipeline description. JSDoc comments on all route handlers and helper functions. Swagger UI integrated via swagger.json at /api-docs. Missing .env.example but no env vars needed beyond PORT.

teams.summary: Solid, clean project. Good fundamentals — parameterized queries, proper HTTP codes, Swagger docs, SonarCloud integration. Minor issues: leftover console.logs and no .env.example.
tips: Remove or reduce console.log statements in production code — use a logger like winston or pino with log levels instead
Extract toObj/toArray helpers into a utils/ file to keep routes/todo.js focused on routing logic
Add a .env.example file so others know which env vars are available (PORT, NODE_ENV)

code_quality.details: Excellent structure: helmet for security headers, morgan for logging, global error handler middleware. Helpers extracted to utils/helpers.js. .env.example present. Husky + commitlint for commit conventions. Errors forwarded with next(err) instead of inline catch — clean Express pattern. No eval(), no debug endpoint, no hardcoded secrets. swagger-jsdoc generates docs from inline annotations. Only minor: dotenv loaded in database.js.

documentation.details: Outstanding README: badges, table of contents, installation, env vars, scripts table, full API reference with request/response examples, project structure, Docker instructions, security section, and live demo link. Swagger annotations on every route with full schema definitions. CHANGELOG.md auto-generated. .env.example included.

teams.summary: One of the strongest projects. Professional-grade setup with helmet, morgan, husky, commitlint, and a global error handler. Comprehensive documentation with full API reference in README and Swagger.
tips: Consider moving dotenv.config() to a single entry point instead of database.js
Name your PRs with conventional commit format (feat: xxx, fix: xxx) — squash merges use the PR title as the commit message
Add a .env.example entry for API_URL to document the Swagger server URL configuration

code_quality.details: Decent structure with routes/, database/, helpers.js. Parameterized queries, proper HTTP codes. Has .env.example. However: /debug endpoint exists (gated behind NODE_ENV=development but still in codebase — exposes SECRET_KEY and API_KEY). No try/catch on GET/PUT/DELETE routes in todo.js — only POST and search have error handling. No global error handler. Console.log in root endpoint. App listens unconditionally (no test guard).

documentation.details: Good README with badges, features, stack description, install/run instructions, Docker, and security scan instructions (CodeQL, Trivy). Swagger-jsdoc annotations on all routes. Missing: env vars documentation table, project structure overview. CHANGELOG.md present (auto-generated).

teams.summary: Good foundation but inconsistent error handling — some routes have try/catch, others don't. The /debug endpoint is a security concern even when gated. App doesn't properly export for testing.
tips: Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — it exposes environment variables and secrets
Add try/catch to all route handlers (GET /, GET /:id, PUT, DELETE are unprotected)
Wrap app.listen in a condition (require.main === module or NODE_ENV !== 'test') for proper test support

code_quality.details: Clean code with helmet for security, swagger-jsdoc, .env.example, proper module export pattern (require.main === module). Global error handler present. Utils extracted to utils/helpers.js. No eval(), no debug endpoint, parameterized queries throughout. Separate CI workflows for develop and main branches. Minor: no try/catch in route handlers (errors go to global handler which is fine but less specific). OpenAPI spec exposed at /openapi.json.

documentation.details: Comprehensive README: table of contents, stack info, prerequisites, install, env vars table, Docker instructions with GHCR pull command, endpoint table with examples, Swagger docs reference, CI/CD description with secrets table. Swagger annotations on routes. Missing: project structure diagram.

teams.summary: Well-architected project with good security (helmet), proper export pattern, and thorough documentation. Dual CI pipelines for develop/main is a nice touch. Clean, professional codebase.
tips: Add try/catch blocks in route handlers for more specific error messages (current global handler returns generic 500)
Add a .env.example file with all supported variables documented
Consider adding a CHANGELOG.md with conventional commits or release-please

code_quality.details: Good structure with thorough JSDoc comments. Kubernetes manifests (kustomize overlays for dev/integration/prod) show advanced deployment. release-please for versioning. knip for dead code detection. /debug endpoint present (gated behind NODE_ENV !== production but still a concern). formatTodo/formatTodos use verbose var/for-loop style instead of modern JS. No try/catch in route handlers. Swagger via static JSON file.

documentation.details: Solid README: badges, features list, prerequisites, install, run, test, Docker, full API reference with examples. Swagger UI at /docs. Missing: env vars documentation, project structure. No .env.example. CHANGELOG.md auto-generated.

teams.summary: Impressive infrastructure (K8s, ArgoCD, release-please, knip) but code has stylistic issues — verbose formatTodo/formatTodos, /debug endpoint. Good Swagger docs and comprehensive README.
tips: Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — it exposes environment variables and secrets
Add a .env.example file so others know which env vars are needed
Replace verbose formatTodo/formatTodos with modern destructuring or spread — the current var/for-loop style is harder to maintain

code_quality.details: Minimal app.js — just express.json(), root endpoint, health, and router. No security middleware (no helmet). No error handling — no try/catch in any route, no global error handler. No Swagger/API docs endpoint. No .env.example. Prettierrc present which is good. Code works but is essentially the bare minimum over the original sabotaged version. Helpers (toObj/toArray) duplicated in routes file.

documentation.details: README is essentially empty: 'a todo api' + 'npm install / npm start' + one SonarCloud badge. No API docs, no env vars, no project structure, no Docker instructions, no feature description. No Swagger endpoint.

teams.summary: Bare minimum effort. Code works but lacks error handling, security, and documentation. The README is nearly empty and there's no API documentation.
tips: Update your README with real setup instructions, API docs, and badges
Add Swagger/OpenAPI docs — Express can use swagger-jsdoc + swagger-ui-express easily
Add try/catch error handling to all routes and consider a global error handler middleware

code_quality.details: Modern ES modules throughout. Uses @scalar/express-api-reference for API docs (nicer than basic Swagger UI). .env.example present. /debug endpoint gated behind NODE_ENV=development. vitest for testing (modern choice). esbuild for bundling. Clean route handlers with early returns. Separate CI and CD workflows. compose.yml for local dev. No global error handler but routes are clean. CHANGELOG.md auto-generated.

documentation.details: Excellent README: CI/CD badges, table of contents, prerequisites, install, env vars table, run/test commands, Docker instructions with GHCR pull, full API reference with all endpoints, query params, request/response examples. CI/CD pipeline described in detail. Well-structured and thorough.

teams.summary: Strong project with modern tooling (ES modules, vitest, esbuild, Scalar API docs). Excellent documentation. /debug endpoint is the main concern but properly gated.
tips: Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — even gated behind NODE_ENV, it's better to remove it entirely in production builds
Add a global error handler middleware for unexpected errors
Consider adding helmet for security headers — it's a quick win

code_quality.details: Best code quality in the class. Zod validation schemas for all inputs (create, update, pagination, search). Helmet for security. Morgan for logging. Rate limiting with express-rate-limit. Request ID tracking (X-Request-ID). CORS configuration via env var. Proper error handler with env-aware messages (hides details in production). All routes use next(err) pattern. .env.example with all vars documented. Husky pre-commit/pre-push hooks. ESLint with comprehensive config. pnpm. No eval(), no debug endpoint, no hardcoded secrets.

documentation.details: Good README: badges, stack, setup instructions, env vars table with defaults, Docker, available commands, endpoint table, environment deployment table. Extremely detailed Swagger annotations with multiple examples per endpoint, error cases, validation error schemas. Missing: full API reference in README (relies on /docs). Could use a project structure section.

teams.summary: The gold standard. Input validation with Zod, security hardening (helmet, rate limiting, CORS, request IDs), proper error handling, and the most detailed Swagger docs in the class. Exemplary CI/CD setup.
tips: Add a project structure section to the README for quick orientation
Consider adding a /health endpoint response time metric for monitoring
The Swagger docs are incredibly detailed — consider extracting the spec to a YAML file for easier editing

code_quality.details: Clean separation: app.js, server.js, routes/, database/, docs/. Per-environment .env files (.env.development, etc.). Swagger via swagger-jsdoc. .env.example present. Proper try/catch with consistent error responses. Parameterized queries. No eval(), no debug endpoint. docker-compose.yml. SonarCloud integration. Minor: console.log in GET /todos, some console.error without structured logging.

documentation.details: Good README with many badges (Node.js, Express, Jest, ESLint, CI, Deploy, SonarCloud quality gate). Stack description, install instructions, scripts, endpoint list, curl examples. Swagger at /api-docs. Missing: env vars table, Docker instructions, project structure. Live demo URL provided.

teams.summary: Solid project with good separation of concerns (app/server split). Per-environment .env files is a nice touch. Good CI/CD with SonarCloud. Documentation is good but could use more detail.
tips: Add an env vars documentation table to the README — the per-environment .env pattern is great but needs docs
Replace console.log/console.error with a structured logger (winston/pino)
Add Docker build/run instructions to the README

code_quality.details: Strong code: Zod validation for create/update with custom error messages. Parameterized queries throughout. Clean route ordering (search before :id). .env.example present. Swagger-jsdoc annotations. PR template for code reviews. Trivy for vulnerability scanning. Gitleaks for secret scanning. Performance check script. No eval(), no debug endpoint. require.main === module pattern. Minor: console.log in routes (creating todo, found X todos).

documentation.details: README has good badges (CI, Docker, Deploy, Coverage, Quality Gate). Basic install/lint/test instructions. CI and deployment sections explain the pipeline well. SonarCloud setup documented. However: no API endpoint documentation, no env vars table, no Docker instructions, no project structure. README is functional but sparse on API details.

teams.summary: Excellent CI/CD pipeline (Gitleaks, Trivy, SonarCloud, separate deploy workflows) and good code quality with Zod validation. README covers DevOps well but lacks API documentation.
tips: Add API endpoint documentation to the README — currently no way for someone to know the routes without reading code
Remove console.log statements from route handlers — use a proper logger
Add Docker build/run instructions and env vars table to README

code_quality.details: Good separation: routes/utils.js for formatTodo/formatTodos, handleRouteError for consistent 500 responses. /debug endpoint present but gated (returns 404 outside development — better than most). Swagger via YAML file (docs/swagger.yml). .env.example. Prettierrc. Comprehensive JSDoc on all functions. docker-compose.yml for dev and production. Vercel-aware config. Minor: README is duplicated (entire content appears twice). /debug still exposes process.env in dev.

documentation.details: README has badges and covers basics (install, structure, endpoints, scripts, contributing guidelines). Swagger via docs/swagger.yml at /api-docs. However: README content is duplicated (appears twice in the file — copy-paste error). No env vars table. Endpoint docs are brief (just route + description, no examples). 'Suggestions / prochaines étapes' section feels unfinished.

teams.summary: Decent code with good patterns (handleRouteError, utils extraction, JSDoc). The duplicated README is a visible quality issue. /debug endpoint better gated than most but still a concern.
tips: Fix the README — the entire content is duplicated (copy-paste error). Clean it up
Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — it exposes process.env which includes all environment variables
Add request/response examples to the endpoint documentation

code_quality.details: Excellent architecture: Zod validation schemas in dedicated file (routes/schemas/todo.schemas.js). Helmet via separate config. ES modules. Helpers extracted to helpers/utils.js. Swagger config in config/swagger.js. Every route has try/catch with consistent error handling. validate() utility for clean schema application. .env.example. Renovate for dependency updates. CHANGELOG.md. No eval(), no debug endpoint. Clean, well-organized codebase.

documentation.details: Good README: badges, tech table, detailed local deploy instructions, env vars section, scripts table, project structure, license, Docker deploy with GHCR pull command. Swagger at /api-docs with full annotations. Missing: API endpoint reference in README (relies on Swagger). Could document the Zod validation behavior.

teams.summary: Excellent code architecture with proper separation of concerns (schemas, config, helpers). Zod validation, helmet, Renovate for deps. Clean and professional. Documentation is good but could include API reference in README.
tips: Add a brief API endpoint reference to the README — not everyone will run the server just to see /api-docs
Document the validation behavior (what 422 responses look like) in the README
Consider adding rate limiting — the architecture is clean enough to add it easily
